item.name: Arcane Gems
entries: A small leather bag of {@dice 1d6 + 1} gems.
Whenever you cast a spell you can use one of these gems as a component. The gem is consumed and the spell gains one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Arcane Potential
entries: The spell is cast at one level higher to a maximum of 9th level.

entries.name: Indisputable Power
entries: The spell gains a +2 bonus to it's DC

entries.name: Pinpoint Accuracy
entries: The spell gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls

entries.name: Scarring Attack
entries: The spell deals 2 additional die of damage, if the spell deals no damage the component is wasted and consumed.

item.name: Blood Pearl Necklace
entries: A pearl necklace of blood red pearls.
Whenever you are hit by an attack you can use your reaction to create a blood shield around you, granting you a +5 bonus to Armor Class, potentially causing the attack to miss

entries.name: Cursed
entries: Whenever you use this item you take necrotic damage equal to half your Armor Class. This damage can't be prevented.

item.name: Feather of Flight
entries: While having this feather on your person you gain a fly speed of 40 ft. If you already have a fly speed you gain an additional 20 ft. movement speed while flying.

item.name: Golden Heart Pendant
entries: A small golden heart on a golden chain.
While wearing this necklace you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Golden Regeneration
entries: Whenever you would regain hit points you regain the maximum possible.

entries.name: Golden Constitution
entries: Your constitution becomes 21 unless it already is 21 or higher.

item.name: Potion of Regeneration
entries: When you drink this potion you regain {@dice 4d4 + 4} hit points and at the start of each of your turns for the next minute you regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points.

item.name: Potion of Clarity
entries: When you drink this potion you have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell when you take damage, for the next hour.

item.name: Sacred Prayer Beads
entries: Polished wooden orbs on a string, consecrated in holy water.

You can use these prayer beads as a spellcasting focus. This item has 10 charges and regains 1d10 charges each dawn. Whenever you use this item as a spellcasting focus for your cleric or paladin spells you can an appropriate number of charges and say a small prayer to gain one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Healing Grace
entries: You expend 1 charge and when you would normally roll one or more dice to restore hit points with a spell, you instead use the highest number possible for each die.

entries.name: Searing Grace
entries: You expend 2 charges and when you would normally roll one or more dice to deal fire og radiant damage with a spell, you instead use the highest number of possible for each die.

entries.name: Bolstering Grace
entries: You can expend a charge and whenever you use a spell to restore hit points to a creature any healing over the creatures hit point maximum is turned into temporary hitpoints.

item.name: Scroll Holder
entries: This simplistic scroll holder can hold up to 20 scrolls.

Whenever a scroll that is on your spell list is stored within the scroll holder it counts as if you know it, and uses your spell DC and attack modifier. Casting the spell on the scroll still consumes the scroll and requires an arcana check if it is a higher level than you could normally cast.

item.name: Spellslinger
entries: This fancy leather glove allows for pin point accuracy for spells.
When you make a ranged spell attack you gain a bonus to the attack roll depending on your level, as shown on the table below.

trait.name: Fiery Blaze
entries: Cinder Knight's Attacks deal an additional die of fire damage. (This is already in attacks).

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage.
Cinder Knight's are undead fallen who died failing to fulfill their oaths and were revived with a burning rage of their failure.
